intro: Scrophularia hilbigii, commonly known as the Hilbig's figwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the genus. Scrophularia hilbigii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
